unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **smart meter rollout gains momentum in maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) is accelerating its smart meter deployment across the state, aiming for near-universal coverage by December 2025. The initiative is a key component of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) and promises to enhance billing accuracy, reduce power theft, and improve grid management.
normalised: mumbai, maharashtra - the maharashtra state electricity distribution company limited (M S E D C L) is accelerating its smart meter deployment across the state, aiming for near-universal coverage by december two thousand and twenty five. the initiative is a key component of the revamped distribution sector scheme (R D S S) and promises to enhance billing accuracy, reduce power theft, and improve grid management.

unnormalised: Initial phases have focused on urban centers like Pune and Nagpur. Data from a pilot project conducted in Nashik between 01/01/2023 and 31/03/2023 showed a 15% reduction in Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses. MSEDCL officials, speaking at a press conference at 11:00 hrs on 26/10/2024, indicated that the rollout will now extend to rural areas, with a target of installing 5 million smart meters by mid-2025. Consumer awareness campaigns, utilizing both traditional media and digital platforms, are planned to educate citizens on the benefits of smart metering, including prepaid options and real-time energy consumption monitoring. Concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through robust cybersecurity measures, ensuring compliance with Indian data protection regulations. The total investment in the smart meter project is estimated at Rs. 10,000 crore.
